FuncDef:
The port-forwarding address-group command configures a NAT address pool and port range for the dynamic association of internal servers.
The undo port-forwarding address-group command deletes a NAT address pool and port range configured for the dynamic association of internal servers.
By default, no NAT address pool and port range are configured for the dynamic association of internal servers.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a NAT address pool.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the start port number of a port range.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 65535.

Specifies the end port number of a port range.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 65535.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The IP addresses of internal servers may frequently change. To avoid frequent manual modification of the configurations of internal NAT servers, you can deploy the port forwarding function to dynamically associate each internal server with a public network IP address and port.
Precautions
A global static address pool does not support the port-forwarding function.
After you run the port-forwarding address-group command, all the ports in the specified port range in the address pool are no longer used as public network ports for NAT.
This command configures only the port range of the port forwarding service. The port forwarding rules, however, are issued by the RADIUS server when the user gets online.
A maximum of 4096 ports can be configured for parameters start-port and end-port in this command.
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
